FuncDef:
The loopback internal command configures the internal loopback detection mode on an interface.
The undo loopback internal command disables the internal loopback detection mode on an interface. The loopback internal command configures the internal loopback detection mode on an interface. The undo loopback internal command disables the internal loopback detection mode on an interface. By default, internal loopback detection is not configured on an interface.
ParentView: Layer 2 100GE interface view,100GE interface view,Layer 2 10GE interface view,10GE interface view,Layer 2 200GE interface view,200GE interface view,25GE-L2 view,25GE interface view,400GE-L2 view,400GE interface view,Layer 2 50GE interface view,50GE interface view,Interface group view
ExtraInfo: Before testing some special functions such as locating an Ethernet fault, enable loopback detection on the desired Ethernet interface to check whether the interface is working properly. If no fault occurs on the Ethernet interface, the physical and protocol statuses of the interface are always up after loopback detection is enabled. If a fault occurs, the statuses remain down. After the internal loopback is configured, the test packets sent from the interface are sent back to the interface through the system.
